RESTAPI repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new note for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified Email for a specific user. :param contact_email: The Email of the contact to retrieve. :type contact_email: str :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified Email, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to retrieve. :type contact_id: int :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_first_name(first_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified First Name for a specific user. :param first_name: The First Name of the contact to retrieve. :type first_name: str :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified First Name, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_last_name(last_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified Last Name for a specific user. :param last_name: The Last Name of the contact to retrieve. :type last_name: str :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified Last Name, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user. :param user: The user to retrieve contacts for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: A list of contacts. :rtype: List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

RESTAPI repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirmed Email in database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The Email of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The Email was confirmed, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new note for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Retrieves a single user with the specified Email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The Email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified Email, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a single user with the specified Email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to update

  • url – str: Specify the url of avatar to update

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

The updated user, or none if it does not exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update token for user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (Union[str, None]) – New token for user

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The token was update, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

None

RESTAPI routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact by email.

If the contact is not found, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the contact to be fetched

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact by email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_first_name(first_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_first_name function returns a contact by first name.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • first_name: str, the first name of the contact to be returned.

  • db: Session = Depends(get_db), an instance of a database session that is used to query for contacts. This parameter is optional and defaults to None if not provided when calling this function. If no value is provided, then get_contact_by_first_name will use its own default value (Depends(get-db)).

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Pass the first name of the contact to be searched

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the first name

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_last_name(last_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_last_name function returns a contact by last name.

The function takes in the last_name parameter and uses it to query the database for a contact with that last name. If no such contact exists, an HTTPException is raised indicating that no such resource was found.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Specify the last name of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact with the last name that is passed in as a parameter

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that are due in the next seven days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer, which is the id of the contact to be removed. It also takes in a Session object and a User object as parameters, but these are not required by default.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the path parameter

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing the new information for that contact. It returns an object with all of the information about that user.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user and to check if they are authorized to delete a contact

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

RESTAPI routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

The function takes in a parameter of the current_user, which is obtained from auth_service.get_current_user(). This function will return an error if there is no logged in user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function takes in a file, current_user, and db. It then uploads the file to cloudinary with the public id of Contacts/username. The function then returns a user object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A user object, which is the updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

RESTAPI routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. Then, it checks if there is a user with that email in the database. If not, an error message will be returned saying &quot;Verification Error&quot;. If there is a user with that email, then we check if they have already confirmed their account or not. If they have already confirmed their account, then we return another message saying &quot;Your Email Is Already Confirmed&quot;. Otherwise (if they haven’t yet

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make requests on behalf of that user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A token, but it doesn’t return the user data

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

The function takes in a current_user parameter, which is an instance of the User class. This parameter depends on auth_service.get_current_user to get the currently logged-in user’s information from their JWT token.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict containing the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if there is already a user with that email address in the database, and if so, it sends them an email containing their username and confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which contains the username and email of the new user. The function then checks if there is already an existing account with that email address, and if so it raises an HTTPException to indicate that this is not allowed. If no such account exists yet, it hashes the password using auth_service’s get_password_hash() function (which uses Argon2), and then calls repository_users’ create_user() function to add this information to our database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add the task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded by the client. It also takes in current_user, which is the user who’s currently logged into our app and db, which represents our database session.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s email from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

RESTAPI services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

The function takes in the data to be encoded, and an optional expires_delta parameter. If no expires_delta is provided, the default value of 150 minutes will be used.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a token that is used to verify the user’s email address. The token contains the following information:

  • iat (issued at): The time when the token was created.

  • exp (expiration): The time when this token will expire, which is 7 days from now.

  • scope: This indicates what type of action can be performed with this particular JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

Returns:

A token that is used to verify the user’s email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing the user’s id, username, email address, and password hash. Expires_delta is an optional argument that sets how long the refresh token will be valid for (defaults to 7 days). The function then encodes this information into JSON Web Tokens using PyJWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

A jwt token that is encoded with the user’s data and an expiration date

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail ‘Invalid scope for token’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user, which is stored in the sub claim

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first tries to decode the JWT using the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in settings.py, then checks if the scope of this payload is ‘email_token’. If it is, it returns the email address associated with this payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested the password reset

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password and returns the hashed version of it. The hashing algorithm is defined in the settings file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashes it using the same salt that was used to hash the original password. If the two hashes match, then we know that the user entered in their correct password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Get the password from the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is correct

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

RESTAPI services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three arguments:

  1. The user’s email address as a string.

  2. The username of the user as a string. This is used for personalization purposes only, and is not stored anywhere on our servers or in any database.

  3. A hostname that will be used for generating links within the body of the message.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

RESTAPI services Utils¶

src.services.utils.calc_birthday(data)¶

The calc_birthday function takes a date object as input and returns the number of days until the next birthday. If today is your birthday, it will return 0.

Parameters:

data – Pass the birth date of a person to the function

Returns:

The number of days until the next birthday

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.utils.next_seven_days(contacts)¶

The next_seven_days function takes a list of contacts and returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next seven days.

Parameters:

contacts – Pass in the list of contacts

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next seven days

Doc-author:

Trelent
